qas.question: In what year did Notre Dame first have a facility in England?
At which location is the London Center operated by Notre Dame found?
Notre Dame has a center in Beijing, what is it referred to as?
In what year did the Suffolk Street location start to house a Notre Dame facility?

context: The university owns several centers around the world used for international studies and research, conferences abroad, and alumni support. The university has had a presence in London, England, since <a0_0>1968<a0_0/>. Since <a3_0>1998<a3_0/>, its London center has been based in the former United University Club at <a1_0>1 Suffolk Street in Trafalgar Square<a1_0/>. The center enables the Colleges of Arts & Letters, Business Administration, Science, Engineering and the Law School to develop their own programs in London, as well as hosting conferences and symposia. Other <a2_0>Global Gateways<a2_0/> are located in Beijing, Chicago, Dublin, Jerusalem and Rome.
